newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Gunmen kill Pakistani Shi'ite activist.
newsitem.headline: Gunmen kill Pakistani Shi'ite activist.

text.p: Gunmen killed a Shi'ite Moslem activist in Pakistan's central province of Punjab on Tuesday in the latest incident in a wave of sectarian violence, police said.

They said Mumtaz Hasan Shah, joint secretary of the Shi'ite Tehrik-i-Jafaria party for Hasilpur sub-district in southern Punjab, was shot at a drugstore at Hasilpur town by two gunmen who arrived on a motorcyle. The gunmen later fled the scene.
There was no immediate claim of responsibility.
The shooting appeared to be the latest in a series of attacks in Punjab blamed on rival militant factions of the majority Sunni and the minority Shi'ite sects of Islam.
Violence among Sunni and Shi'ite factions there has cost nearly 100 lives so far this year.
Shi'ites form about 15 percent of Pakistan's mainly Sunni population of more than 135 million but form a majority in neighbouring Iran.
